titleStmt.title: Grant Green to James F. Robinson
CWG8699

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Auditor's Office, Kentucky,
Frankfort, 4th Feb, 1863.
, Esq.:
Dear Sir:
His Excellency
Govr Robinson
Sir

Mr. Mulhors one of the Securities of Yelten former Shff of Pendleton County has this day paid in full all the principal interest and costs to this date being in full except damages -- The execution is now in the hands of the Sheriff, and I cant therefore give a receipt in full until the execution is returned --
The Judgment was against Isaac L. Yelton & his sureties at the Feb term 1855 for the revenue of 1854. on balance of $660 66/100 and damages $131 13/100.

Franklin Cir Ct
$131.13/100 } Damages
Sheriff of Pendleton
His Excellency,
Govr Robinson
Is Feby 4. 1863
